alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Franklin; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Pittsylvania, south central Bedford and east central Franklin Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Huddleston to near Western Smith Mountain Lake. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huddleston... Penhook... Sago... Smith Mountain Lake State Park... Western Smith Mountain Lake... Pittsville... and Union Hall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
